programme.title: Charlemagne: Father of Europe
programme.sub-title: The Making of Emperor Charles the Great
programme.desc: Meet Charles the Great, the Carolingian king who would become Charlemagne.

programme.title: Charlemagne: Father of Europe
programme.desc: Go back to the formative years of Charlemagne's life before he ascended to the imperial throne.

programme.title: Charlemagne: Father of Europe
programme.desc: See how Charlemagne's rule altered Europe and shaped his reputation for generations.

programme.title: Charlemagne: Father of Europe
programme.sub-title: Charlemagne as Head of Family and Dynasty
programme.desc: The king's relations with his wives and children had long-lasting political repercussions.

programme.title: An Economic History of the World Since 1400
programme.desc: How is economic history different from a history of economics? What are the concerns of economic historians?

programme.title: An Economic History of the World Since 1400
programme.sub-title: Marco Polo, China, and Silk Road Trade
programme.desc: Examine the state of the global economy circa 1400, when Europe was at the bottom of the economic ladder.

programme.title: An Economic History of the World Since 1400
programme.desc: Learn how Europe's manorial societies helped bring about the medieval commercial revolution.

programme.title: An Economic History of the World Since 1400
programme.sub-title: How Black Death Reshaped Town and Field
programme.desc: Discover how the Black Death made the medieval feudal system untenable.

programme.title: 1066: The Year That Changed Everything
programme.desc: What makes 1066 such a pivotal year in the history of Western civilization?

programme.title: 1066: The Year That Changed Everything
programme.sub-title: England and Normandy before the Conquest
programme.desc: Take a closer look at the chaos between 1016 and 1066, when power was up for grabs.

programme.title: 1066: The Year That Changed Everything
programme.desc: How did a "confessor" and "bastard" put England and Normandy on a collision course?

programme.title: 1066: The Year That Changed Everything
programme.desc: Revisit one of the most important moments in English history: the Battle of Hastings.

programme.title: Years That Changed History: 1215
programme.desc: Begin your survey of this amazing year with some context on the state of the world before 1215.

programme.title: Years That Changed History: 1215
programme.sub-title: The Magna Carta: Patching Up a Squabble
programme.desc: Discover the surprisingly narrowly focused origins of a short-lived document.

programme.title: Years That Changed History: 1215
programme.sub-title: What's Really in the Magna Carta?
programme.desc: Continue your study of the Magna Carta by investigating some of its most interesting clauses.

programme.title: Years That Changed History: 1215
programme.desc: In this episode, trace the Magna Carta's intriguing story across the ages.

programme.title: The Life and Works of Jane Austen
programme.desc: Get an overview of the historical and literary context that shaped the life and work of Jane Austen.

programme.title: The Life and Works of Jane Austen
programme.sub-title: Life and Letters: The Genuine Austen
programme.desc: A look at Jane's surviving letters and the facts and fictions that have persisted over time about her life.

programme.title: The Life and Works of Jane Austen
programme.desc: Explore her juvenilia and discover the surprising beginnings of her literary efforts.

programme.title: The Life and Works of Jane Austen
programme.desc: Meet the Dashwood sisters and follow their pursuit of happiness and an introduction to Austen’s style.

programme.title: The Life and Works of Jane Austen
programme.desc: Pride and Prejudice has a deeply devoted fanbase of both literary critics and everyday readers.

programme.title: The Life and Works of Jane Austen
programme.sub-title: Mansfield Park: Silence, Place, and Price
programme.desc: Mansfield Park is perhaps the most controversial of all of Austen’s finished novels.

programme.title: Notorious London: A City Tour
programme.desc: Examine how immense wealth and privilege'for some'left its imprint on the city and its history

programme.title: Notorious London: A City Tour
programme.sub-title: St. Paul's Cathedral in Faith, Fire, and Sin
programme.desc: Uncover the history of a church that has been so much more than a place of worship for the people of London

programme.title: Notorious London: A City Tour
programme.sub-title: Getting Blitzed at London's Café de Paris
programme.desc: Go back in time to an evening in March of 1941, when the Caf' de Paris was destroyed in the Blitz.
